setting.active.label: Enable Target Recall
setting.active.description: Enables target recall for the client. This can be disabled at the token level by right clicking that token's target action on the token's HUD.
setting.clear.label: Clear Targets
setting.clear.description: Clears targets at start of turn if no target history (including if Target Recall is disabled for this client or for the token.)
setting.control.label: Select Token on Turn Start
setting.control.description: Automatically selects the owner's token on that token's turn start. Note that other modules may also do this so only enable if not already occurring.
setting.history.label: Target History Rounds Retained
setting.history.description: Set the number of rounds of target history to retain for each token. Token controllers may toggle through their target history by using the < and > keybinds, if that settings is enabled.
setting.keybind.label: Enable '<' and '>' keybinds
setting.keybind.description: Enables the CTRL+< (i.e comma) and CTRL+> (i.e. period) keybinds for toggling through target history on the token.

marker.label: Target Marker
marker.description: Requires Sequencer module installed. Select the temporary token marker to be displayed for the current combatant when the controller changes targets.
marker.duration.label: Target Marker Duration
marker.duration.description: Indicate in milliseconds how long to display the target marker after targeting (target marker requires Sequencer module installed).
marker.scale.label: Target Marker Scale
marker.scale.description: Scale the target marker size for a 1 x 1 grid-sized token. Marker size will automatically scale relative to token size for larger or smaller sized tokens (target marker requires Sequencer module installed).

setting.finder.duration.label: Target Finder Duration
setting.finder.duration.description: Indicate in milliseconds how long to display the target finder after targeting
setting.finder.alias-suppress.label: Suppress Alias in Target Finder
setting.finder.alias-suppress.description: By default, the target finder displays the token image, token alias, and distance. This settings suppresses the display of the token alias.
